subject: Technology
title: TikTok and the Short Video Revolution
description: A quick win: understand TikTok and the Short Video Revolution.

hook.text: Most social networks grew from Silicon Valley. TikTok came from Beijing and rewrote all the rules.

buildup.text: TikTok's algorithm doesn't care who you follow. It shows you what it thinks you'll watch, from anyone.

discovery.text: This meant a first-time creator could go viral immediately. Followers didn't matter; content did.

twist.text: TikTok's addictive feed raised alarms. Average users spend 95 minutes per day on it.

climax.text: Every major platform copied TikTok's short video format. Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts followed.

punchline.text: TikTok proved the algorithm matters more than the follow button.

quiz.question: What makes TikTok's algorithm different from earlier social networks?
options: It only shows content from people you follow
It recommends content based on interest, not followers
